description: From Hindi पलंग पोश (palaṅg poś, “coverlet”), from पलंग (palaṅg, “bed”) + early modern Persian پوش‎ (“cover”).

entries.meaning: (now historical) A rich cotton cloth, originally made in India, used for bedspreads and shawls. [from 17th c.]
examples: He fancied, however, that he perceived, amongst the brambles and briars, some gigantic flowers but was mistaken: for these were only the dangling palampores and variegated tatters of his gay retinue.
